description: Strange looking 4-dimensional ammo.  Looks like a some sort of metallic flower or claw, with seven to nine "thorns" attached around the proper bullet in the middle, with the exact number varying depending on how you spin it during inspection.  Perhaps due the folding, several of these stack together on a smaller than expected volume, forming an angular, amorphous metal mass.  Trippy to say the least.
//: The thorns have no actual volume or mass, until they do
//2: bullet is made from steel, the flower look as if it was made from brass

description: Strange looking 4-dimensional ammo.  The steel projectile lacks a case, and seems inscribed all over with an unreadable script.  It randomly feels bigger than it looks to the touch, as if it had some sort of invisible shell around it.  There's no problem whatsoever fitting these into their respective magazines, though.

Strange looking 5-dimensional ammo.  It's composed of a source and a stream.  The source are ofuda, featuring an unreadable script.  The stream seems to be the content of this script, read and materialized by the weapon when shooting, consuming each ofuda in the process.
//: For bleeding something out. This would generate a lot of impurity on the target
//2: Damage should be extradimensional: rnd(0.33-0.8) damage to whatever lacking a 'EXTRADIMENSIONAL' flag or something, damages no terrain, things like that
